content.en: Graph domination: Researchers have been investigating the complexity of various domination problems in graph theory and the role of algorithms in solving them. They have found that some of these problems, such as Roman domination and double Roman domination, are NP-complete for certain types of graphs. However, there are also cases where linear time algorithms can be used to solve these problems for specific graph structures, such as trees and cographs.
content.da: Grafdominans: Forskere har undersøgt kompleksiteten af forskellige dominansproblemer inden for grafteori og algoritmers rolle i løsning af dem. De har fundet ud af, at nogle af disse problemer, såsom romersk dominans og dobbelt romersk dominans, er NP-komplette for visse typer af grafer. Dog er der også tilfælde, hvor lineære tidsalgoritmer kan bruges til at løse disse problemer for specifikke grafstrukturer som træer og kografer.
